TopicTitle: Re entry don't affect flight almost non at all :-(

Articles.Content: I have 120% of reentry heat and when i back from Minmus it use only 20 units of 200 from ablative shield ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Heat sheilds are rated for Eve.

Then congratulate the engineering and flight teams on a job well done. Not killing your astronauts is a good thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Heat sheilds are rated for Eve.

And Jool aerocapture...

The last eve aerobrake I did, well it was my first as well, are through around 1000 ablator via two passes at around 70km so they are very useful there. My duna return of the other hand barely went though any coming back to kerbin. I do feel that I add parts because I think they should be there rather than efficiency. Almost all my ships have a heat shield on them as real ones do.

Tell that to [my craft](http://imgur.com/a/Gd3kt#34) for last Reddit challenge. It went bananas several times when I tried to aerobrake at Laythe, and the successful aerobraking only helped a bit, I had to burn the engine before and after the atmo - before to not burn up, after - to insert into orbit. Still lost all the solar panels. Any lower than that and craft goes puff.

So, No, Heating is okay.

Crank it up to 120% and install Deadly Reentry. Yes, direct interplanetary aerobraking after a Hohmann transfer is possible, but you need to do it carefully.

THe heat shields have to be able to take interplanetary reentries, so it makes sense that they wouldn't take much of a hit from a slower reentry. That said, if you do a high-ish reentry from Minmus (35K periapsis), you'll burn away almost 40% of the ablator!
